intro: Bothriocline milanjiensis, commonly known as the Milanjiensia daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like inflorescence composed of yellow ray florets and a central disk of tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in open grasslands and along rocky outcrops, where it thrives in full sun. The botanical features of Bothriocline milanjiensis make it a notable species in the study of regional flora and ecological adaptations.
